intro: Spiraea flexuosa var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf spiraea, is a deciduous shrub native to the northern regions of North America. It features upright, arching stems covered in dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. The leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a smooth or slightly toothed margin, and they turn yellow in the fall. This plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
